intro: Cicerbita kossinskyi, commonly known as the Kossinsky's cicerbita, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Cicerbita kossinskyi is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
